meanings.definition: The use of the metric system of measurement.
meanings.sent1: In science class, we learned about metricism and how it helps us measure things accurately.
meanings.sent2: Countries around the world have adopted metricism as their standard system of measurement.
meanings.sent3: The aliens found our metricism fascinating and decided to use it on their planet too.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to metricism was like a guiding star, always leading her to precise results.
meanings.sent5: Metricism simplifies measurement by using a consistent set of units for length, weight, and volume.

meanings.definition: Adherence to or promotion of the metric system.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's metricism was evident in how she insisted on using metric units in all experiments.
meanings.sent2: His metricism led him to campaign for the conversion of all road signs to kilometers.
meanings.sent3: The metricism of the group was so strong that they even measured their pizza slices in centimeters.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for metricism shone through as she tirelessly advocated for its widespread adoption.
meanings.sent5: Metricism advocates argue that the simplicity of the metric system outweighs any nostalgia for traditional units.

meanings.definition: The belief in the superiority of the metric system.
meanings.sent1: His unwavering metricism made him convinced that the metric system was far better than any other.
meanings.sent2: The company's metricism was so strong that they refused to accept any measurements in non-metric units.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her metricism was so strong, she even dreamt in millimeters.
meanings.sent4: In her eyes, metricism was not just a choice but a clear path to precision and efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The metricism of the engineers was so ingrained that they couldn't imagine working with any other system.
